namespace.title: MetaData Application

namespace.schemaStandardTitle: Geographic information — Metadata — XML schema implementation for fundamental concepts

namespace.title: Metadata for Data and Services
namespace.scope: This namespace contains all classes needed for a complete metadata record for any resource. It is used for metadata records that do not include geospatial common extensions (gex), extenbsions to the schema (mex), data series (DS_*) elements (mda) or metadata for data transfer (mdt).
namespace.encodingRules: ISO/TS 19139:2007, Clause 8 and implementation approach from ISO/TS19115-3, Clause 8
namespace.schemaStandardTitle: Geographic information — Metadata — XML schema implementation for fundamental concepts

namespace.title: Metadata for Data and Services with Geospatial Common Extensions
namespace.scope: This namespace contains all classes needed for a complete metadata record for any resource and enables the use of FileName, MimeType, and Anchor elements (gex).
namespace.encodingRules: ISO/TS 19139:2007, Clause 8 and implementation approach from ISO/TS19115-3, Clause 8
namespace.schemaStandardTitle: Geographic information — Metadata — XML schema implementation for fundamental concepts

namespace.title: Metadata for Data and Services with Geospatial Common Extensions
namespace.scope: This namespace contains all classes needed for a complete metadata record for any resource and enables the description of schema extensions (MD_MetadataExtensionInformation) elements (mex).
namespace.encodingRules: ISO/TS 19139:2007, Clause 8 and implementation approach from ISO/TS19115-3, Clause 8
namespace.schemaStandardTitle: Geographic information — Metadata — XML schema implementation for fundamental concepts

namespace.title: Metadata for Data Transfer
namespace.scope: This namespace contains all classes needed for a complete metadata record for any resource and enables the description of data transfer (MX_*) elements. This is the most inclusive of the ISO 19115-3 namespaces so it should be used in situations where all 19115-3 capabilities are required.
namespace.encodingRules: ISO/TS 19139:2007, Clause 8 and implementation approach from ISO/TS19115-3, Clause 8
namespace.schemaStandardTitle: Geographic information — Metadata — XML schema implementation for fundamental concepts

namespace.title: Metadata with Schema Extensions
namespace.scope: Elements describing extensions to metadata standards.
namespace.encodingRules: ISO/TS 19139:2007, Clause 8 and implementation approach from ISO/TS19115-3, Clause 8
namespace.schemaStandardTitle: Geographic information — Metadata — XML schema implementation for fundamental concepts

namespace.title: Feature Catalog Common

namespace.encodingRules: ISO/TS 19139:2007, Clause 8 and implementation approach from ISO/TS19115-3, Clause 8
namespace.conceptualStandardTitle: Geographic information -- Methodology for feature cataloguing
namespace.schemaStandardTitle: Geographic information — Metadata — XML schema implementation for fundamental concepts

namespace.title: General Feature Catalog
namespace.scope: ISO 19110:2005 defines the methodology for cataloguing feature types and specifies how the classification of feature types is organized into a feature catalogue and presented to the users of a set of geographic data. ISO 19110:2005 is applicable to creating catalogues of feature types in previously uncatalogued domains and to revising existing feature catalogues to comply with standard practice. ISO 19110:2005 applies to the cataloguing of feature types that are represented in digital form. Its principles can be extended to the cataloguing of other forms of geographic data.
namespace.encodingRules: ISO/TS 19139:2007, Clause 8 and implementation approach from ISO/TS19115-3, Clause 8
namespace.conceptualStandardTitle: Geographic information -- Methodology for feature cataloguing
namespace.schemaStandardTitle: Geographic information — Metadata — XML schema implementation for fundamental concepts

namespace.title: Referencing By Coordinates
namespace.scope: ISO 19111:2007 defines the conceptual schema for the description of spatial referencing by coordinates, optionally extended to spatio-temporal referencing. It describes the minimum data required to define one-, two- and three-dimensional spatial coordinate reference systems with an extension to merged spatial-temporal reference systems. It allows additional descriptive information to be provided. It also describes the information required to change coordinates from one coordinate reference system to another.
namespace.encodingRules: ISO/TS 19139:2007, Clause 8 and implementation approach from ISO/TS19115-3, Clause 8
namespace.conceptualStandardTitle: Geographic information -- Spatial referencing by coordinates
namespace.schemaStandardTitle: Geographic information — Metadata — XML schema implementation for fundamental concepts

namespace.scope: abstract classes shared by multiple namespaces and is required in order to enable modularization of the XML implementation.
namespace.encodingRules: ISO/TS 19139:2007, Clause 8 and implementation approach from ISO/TS19115-3, Clause 8
namespace.conceptualStandardTitle: Geographic information -- Spatial referencing by coordinates
namespace.schemaStandardTitle: Geographic information — Metadata — XML schema implementation for fundamental concepts
